bug.author: aksharpatel47
bug.summary: [BUG] Crash on editing a polygon label when new value is not in the label list
bug.description:
Describe the bug When I edit the label on a polygon if the new label is not in the list of labels, the app crashes. However, if I create a new polygon with the new label, I'm able to change the label on other polygons to the new label. The output of the crash: Traceback (most recent call last): File "c:\users\aksha\miniconda3\lib\site-packages\labelme\app.py", line 921, in editLabel item.setData(role=Qt.UserRole, value=shape.label) TypeError: setData() takes no keyword arguments To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Open a directory with labelme annotations Try to edit the label on a polygon shape, to a value that is not a part of the label list
Expected behavior The app should allow editing labels to any value even if it's not a part of the label list. Desktop (please complete the following information):
OS: Windows 10 Labelme Version 4.2.9

comments.comment: I have the same issue as you, but the version I used is 4.2.7
